metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3638 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds memory access flaw was found in the ATI VGA deviceemulation of QEMU. This flaw occurs in the ati_2d_blt() routine whilehandling MMIO write operations when the guest provides invalid values forthe destination display parameters. A malicious guest could use this flawto crash the QEMU process on the host, resulting in a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3638` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-block-extra - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-guest-agent - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-system - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-system-arm - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-system-common - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-system-data - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-system-gui - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-system-mips - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-system-misc - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-system-ppc - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-system-s390x - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-system-sparc - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-system-x86 - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-system-x86-microvm - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-system-x86-xen - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-user - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-user-static - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
qemu-utils - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.15').
